data.label: Baseline & Strategy Review
data.description: Review baseline documentation and strategic alignment.
data.instructions:
# Baseline & Strategy Review

## Objective
Verify that the supplier assessment baseline is documented, maintained, and aligned with company strategy to prevent excess costs and non-compliance.

## Prerequisites
- Access to Means and Methods documentation
- Procurement staff meeting minutes from the last 12 months
- Company/Supply Chain strategy roadmaps

## Procedure
1. **Review Baseline Documentation**
   - Inspect the documented supplier assessment baseline maintained by the Means and Methods function.
   - Verify that the baseline includes criteria for cost, compliance, and strategic fit.

2. **Verify Annual Updates & Approval**
   - Examine evidence of annual updates to the baseline.
   - Cross-reference updates with procurement staff meeting minutes to verify formal approval.

3. **Strategic Alignment Check**
   - Compare supplier profile criteria against current strategic supply chain roadmaps.

## Expected Outputs
- [ ] Baseline Verification Memo — confirmation of documentation and update status
- [ ] Strategic Alignment Assessment — gap analysis between baseline and strategy

## Quality Criteria
- Documentation must be dated within the last 12 months.
- Meeting minutes must explicitly show approval of the baseline by procurement leadership.

data.label: KPI & Control Definition
data.description: Verify KPI definitions and Code of Conduct communication.
data.instructions:
# KPI & Control Definition

## Objective
Ensure that supplier qualification indicators and KPIs are clearly defined and that the Supplier Code of Conduct is effectively communicated.

## Prerequisites
- Supplier Profile Manual
- Sample of Long-Term Agreements (LTAs)
- KPI definition library

## Procedure
1. **Verify KPI Definitions**
   - Review the Supplier Profile Manual to confirm that qualification indicators and KPIs are clearly defined.
   - Ensure KPIs cover performance, risk, and compliance metrics.

2. **Assess Code of Conduct Communication**
   - Sample LTAs to verify the inclusion or communication of the Supplier Code of Conduct.
   - Confirm that the communication is a standard part of the contracting process.

## Expected Outputs
- [ ] KPI Definition Checklist — confirmation of documented indicators
- [ ] Code of Conduct Communication Evidence — verification of LTA clauses

## Quality Criteria
- KPIs must be measurable and relevant to the supplier's role.
- Code of Conduct clauses must be present in 100% of the sampled LTAs.

data.label: Qualification & Profile Testing
data.description: Test supplier qualification execution and profile accuracy.
data.instructions:
# Qualification & Profile Testing

## Objective
Test the execution of supplier qualification procedures and the accuracy of resulting supplier profile scores.

## Prerequisites
- Supplier qualification records (raw data)
- Supplier profile scoring sheets
- Supporting evidence for rating conclusions

## Procedure
1. **Test Qualification Execution**
   - Verify that procurement account managers have executed and documented qualifications for a sample of suppliers.
   - Check for timeliness and completeness of the data.

2. **Verify Score Consolidation**
   - Trace raw qualification data into the final supplier profile scores.
   - Recalculate a sample of scores to ensure mathematical accuracy and consistency.

3. **Review Rating Evidence**
   - Examine the supporting documentation for rating conclusions (e.g., audit reports, performance reviews).

## Expected Outputs
- [ ] Qualification Execution Report — details on completeness/timeliness
- [ ] Scoring Recalculation Worksheet — verification of profile accuracy

## Quality Criteria
- All qualification data must be documented in the official system of record.
- Supporting evidence must justify the final rating assigned to the supplier.

data.label: Periodic Review & Risk Matrix Testing
data.description: Verify risk matrix application and review cycles.
data.instructions:
# Periodic Review & Risk Matrix Testing

## Objective
Verify that suppliers are subject to regular risk assessments and periodic review cycles as defined by the framework.

## Prerequisites
- Supplier Risk Matrix
- List of active suppliers with last review dates
- Periodic review schedule (2-5 year cycles)

## Procedure
1. **Review Risk Matrix Application**
   - Verify that all suppliers are assessed annually using the defined risk matrix.
   - Ensure risk ratings are updated based on recent performance or market changes.

2. **Verify Review Cycles**
   - Confirm that full periodic supplier reviews are performed within the defined 2-5 year cycles.
   - Identify any overdue reviews and document justifications provided by management.

## Expected Outputs
- [ ] Annual Risk Assessment Audit — summary of matrix application
- [ ] Review Cycle Compliance Report — list of suppliers and their review status

## Quality Criteria
- 100% of active suppliers must have an annual risk matrix score.
- Review cycles must not exceed the maximum five-year threshold without formal extension.

data.label: Audit Summary & Reporting
data.description: Assess improvement initiatives and summarize findings.
data.instructions:
# Audit Summary & Reporting

## Objective
Summarize the audit findings and evaluate the effectiveness of improvement initiatives.

## Prerequisites
- Completed testing workpapers from previous steps
- Documentation on supplier improvement initiatives
- Management responses to identified gaps

## Procedure
1. **Assess Improvement Initiatives**
   - Evaluate whether supplier improvement initiatives deliver value and are completed timely.
   - Identify any initiatives that are lagging or failing to meet objectives.

2. **Compile Audit Findings**
   - Consolidate all exceptions and observations from Steps 1 through 4.
   - Assign risk ratings to each finding based on the initial framework risks.

3. **Final Report Preparation**
   - Prepare a succinct summary of the Supplier Risk & Control Assessment.

## Expected Outputs
- [ ] Improvement Initiative Value Assessment — report on initiative ROI
- [ ] Compiled Audit Findings Report — summary of all identified issues

## Quality Criteria
- Findings must be linked directly to the risks identified in the framework.
- Recommendations must be actionable and address the root cause of the control failure.
